page.title: 12ANGUS TRANSMITTING STATION
page.content: THE ANGUS TRANSMITTING STATION MAST IS SITUATED ON TEALING HILL. THE MANAGER IS MISTER PRYDE. THE PRESENT BRITISH TELEVISION SYSTEM USES 625 LINES AND IS BROADCAST AT ULTRA HIGH FREQUENCY (UHF). BECAUSE THE PATH LENGTH OF THESE SIGNALS IS MORE OR LESS LINE OF SIGHT AND THE SIGNAL DECREASES WITH DISTANCE, IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO COVER THE WHOLE OF THE COUNTRY USING ONE TRANSMITTER,RATHER THIS IS DONE BY A NUMBER OF MAIN TRANSMITTERS PLUS A NUMBER OF RELAY STATIONS. IN THE SURVEY AREA AND ADJOINING DISTRICTS , THE MAIN TRANSMITTER IS LOCATED AT TEALING AND BROADCASTS BBC1,BBC2,GRAMPIAN TV AND CHANNEL 4.THE TEALING TRANSMITTER RECEIVES ITS SIGNAL FROM THE ABERDEEN TRANSMITTER LOCATED AT DURRIS.THE MAST IS 750 FT. HIGH. POWER IS CARRIED BY CO_AXIAL CABLES FROM THE TRANSMITTERS.
